alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 3:52PM MST until September 10 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... southern Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 700 PM MST /800 PM MDT/. * At 350 PM MST /450 PM MDT/, National Weather Service Flagstaff Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Linden and Pinedale. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Show Low, Linden, Pinedale, Fort Apache Reservation and Lewis Canyon Group Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 326 and 336. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Pinedale Wash, Show Low Creek, Turkey Canyon, Hog Wash, Cottonwood Wash, Linden Draw, Mud Creek and Dodson Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
